title: change the default organizer email on a calendar event
content: How can I change the default organizer when making a new event in Thunderbird calendar?
creator: dem8383

title: New Message Button Does Not Work On TB v.140.0.1esr Local Folders
content:
[I am starting a new post because I was replying to someone else's post and it stopped working.]

After updating to TB v.140.0esr (then just now updating to v.140.0.1esr) from v.128esr, I cannot compose a new message in any Local Folders or my main virtual inbox. The +New Message button is there, but clicking it does nothing. It was working for over a decade before this.

However, going into the normal account folder inboxes DOES allow me to click the "+New Message" button and start/compose a new message.

I can still reply to messages in the local and virtual folders, just not start a new message.

I have tried disabling all security software. No luck.

I have ran Help > Troubleshoot mode with no addons. No luck.

When I create a new folder under Local Folders, clicking New Message still does nothing while in that new folder. But if I move that new folder to an existing email account, then go to the new folder, clicking New Message works correctly.

I am on Windows 10. I did use the addon Manually Sort Folders in the past, but not recently.

I ran the Check Error Console (ctrl+shift+J) on TB v.140.0esr. Here is the paste:

1752107893534 addons.xpi WARN Checking C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird\distribution\extensions for addons This page is in Quirks Mode. Page layout may be impacted. For Standards Mode use “”. background.html WebExtensions: Import modules with new 'ChromeUtils.importESModule' implementation.js:34 Hello there, I'm BorderColors-D! background.js:11:9 CopySent2Current: 3.39 on Thunderbird 140.0 Received: pong

1.0.9 background.js:141:33 no migration CardBookXULNotifyListener.js:600:13 TypeError: can't access property "document", currentWindow is null implementation.js:568:15 1752107894980 addons.webextension.{a300a000-5e21-4ee0-a115-9ec8f4eaa92b} WARN Loading extension '{a300a000-5e21-4ee0-a115-9ec8f4eaa92b}': Reading manifest: Warning processing locales: An unexpected property was found in the WebExtension manifest. 1752107894980 addons.webextension.{a300a000-5e21-4ee0-a115-9ec8f4eaa92b} WARN Loading extension '{a300a000-5e21-4ee0-a115-9ec8f4eaa92b}': Reading manifest: Warning processing chrome_injectors: An unexpected property was found in the WebExtension manifest. New compose tab 5 with identity id1 styleswitcher.js:31:15 Applying new border style for identity id1 to tab 5 styleswitcher.js:45:13 New compose tab 6 with identity id1 styleswitcher.js:31:15 Applying new border style for identity id1 to tab 6
creator: bigcat21

title: How can I move emails within Thunderbird?
content: How can I move emails within Thunderbird? I want to move emails from the Sent folder of my old email account to the Sent Folder of my current email account. Emails don't move when I right-click on them and select "Move to" and then select the destination folder. All that happens is that the Thunderbird status bar reports: "Looking up pop...." "Connecting to pop..." "Connected to pop..." "Checking mail server capabilities."
creator: leon.arundell

title: Recovering from HDD crash, looking for Thunderbird SENT emails
content:
I'm recovering from a HDD crash that damaged the boot sector only, my files were unharmed. I am/was using Thunderbird. My Roadrunner IN BOUND e-mails were saved on the Roadrunner servers and successfully downloaded to the new Thunderbird client installed on my new hard drive. But none of my SENT e-mails were stored by Roadrunner.

I want to find my old HDD file of SENT e-mails only and move it to my new drive so they'll load in my new Thunderbird. Roadrunner support said they should be on my old HDD but because my old Thunderbird settings were in POP while my new Thunderbird is in IMAP, the file may not be compatible. Of course they gave me incorrect settings also, so not sure if that's accurate.

Regardless, even if incompatible, I want to have some way to access my old sent e-mails for tax and other purposes.

Please help!

Thanks Theo
creator: tchen002
